name: HoloMeeting
slogan: HoloMeeting, a Mixed Reality remote collaboration solution
description:
HoloMeeting is a remote collaboration solving the problem of remote collaboration. 

Using HoloMeeting, you can collaborate across geographical boundaries while it feels like you are in the same physical room.

jobs.title: Senior Technical Artist
jobs.description:
No applicants will be evaluated without applying to the following link: https://hire.withgoogle.com/public/jobs/kazendicom/view/P_AAAAABlAAAnIuWIevVXXrL 

This role requires an experienced software engineer who knows how to lead junior developers and consistently meet company goals. We are a small team, you're the person that gets the job done. If there is a bug thrown, you fix it. In this role you will need to evaluate the highest priority problems and provide solutions through strategic thinking. A "can-do" attitude will take you a long way!

Responsibilities, including but not limited to: 
Development of ultra-fast, massively scalable, highly available holographic meeting solution built on top of Photon 
Implementation of security "best practices” to keep user data secure 
Working with designers, client engineering, and production teams to achieve goals 
Mentoring and managing junior developers

Requirements: 
5+ years Unity experience in a professional development team (we don't count self study^^) 
Virtual Reality or Augmented Reality experience (ideally Microsoft HoloLens) 
Strong .NET/C# 
Photon Networking 
Experience working with cloud-based systems and/or local servers including, but not limited to: web-based protocols, REST APIs, and sockets 
BS in Computer Science

Preferred: 
iOS/Android 
C++ skills (e.g. calling C++ DLLs from within Unity) 
Azure

Skills
Git, UI/UX Design, Unity, Technical Art
Compensation
£20k – £40k 
No equity
Visa Sponsorship
Not available

jobs.title: Video Streaming Programmer C/C++/C#
jobs.description:
We are looking for a highly motivated video streaming expert to join us in our mission to transform how humans work and collaborate together in Mixed Reality.

In this role, you are responsible for developing the video streaming part of HoloMeeting. You will make sure that we have high quality video on all Windows devices (e.g. HoloLens, Immersive Mixed Reality, Surface Hub, etc.), including old hardware. You are leveraging low level audio Media Foundation, open source libraries (FFMPEG) or others to reduce latency, reduce bandwidth and increase quality even on mobile connections. 

You will be involved in new video features, e.g. implementing remote inking (world space to canvas transformation), SSC-HEVC and others.


Responsibilities, including but not limited to:
Development of low-latency video streaming
Implementation of latest streaming technologies (Salsify, etc.)
Implementation of latest codecs (HEVC, VP9, etc.)

Requirements:
3+ years video programming experience 
Deep knowledge of low level APIs (Media Foundation, etc.) 
C++ video programming
Strong C#/.NET skills 
Good understanding of streaming containers.

Preferred:
Ideally knowledge of Unity game engine
Ideally good knowledge of C 
Photon Networking
Experience working with cloud-based systems and/or local servers including, but not limited to: web-based protocols, REST APIs, and sockets
WebRTC


Work Environment
We are a startup and this job operates in a remote environment. Candidates should have flexible working hours to accommodate this role and the company growth. We do not intend to work longer than necessary, however, we are looking for people who get things done when necessary.
